page.title: 14The Moot Hall Keswick
page.content: The Moot Hall was built in 1571.It was used for a Court House and Prison.This was rebuilt in 1695.The clock bell and materials were from Lords Island on Derwent Water.Again rebuilt in 1813. Inside the Moot Hall there is an informtion centre.Here visitors come to find out where they can stay and also where they could go walking over fells.They also go to find out when any sorts of entertainment is on. Most Saturdays there is a coffee morning on the first floor.Each week there is a different coffee morning to raise money for local funds and charities.Some times they even sell things to raise money as well.They raise nerly Â£100 week for various charities.
